messageBody:
love wrote:
>
>
> I have 10 Junit tests in my TestSuite starting test Functions like
> ...extends TestCase{
> testa1()
> testb2().....
>
> ...
> testj10()
> }
>
>
> and I can run each one separately with IntellijIdea Editor.
> Say I can run only testa1() or testb2() or ...
>
> OR whole MyTest Class.
>
>
> What can I do to have such a facility through java code using JUnit.
>
> How can I select which test to run ? even though I have read all
> tutorials and practically conducted most of the tests successfully,
> about this feature I am ignorant.

Create a TestSuite of only one test. You can choose the test to execute
by setting the test's name:

public class SingleTest {
public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
MyTestCase test = new MyTestCase();
test.setName("testHello");
suite.add(test);
}
}

Good luck.
